stimulusHtml: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

features.html:
Iris approaches the dying Dido.

Ergo Iris croceis per caelum roscida pennis1

mille trahens varios adverso sole colores

devolat et supra caput astitit.2 “Hunc ego Diti3

Line sacrum iussa fero teque isto corpore solvo.”4

(5) Sic ait et dextra crinem secat.5

1 penna, pennae, f.: wing

2 asto, astare, astiti: stand nearby

3 Dis, Ditis, m.: Dis, lord of the Underworld

4 solvo, solvere, solvi, solutum: release

5 seco, secare, secui, sectum: cut (off)

Aeneid 4. 700-704
